section.title: Part B: Stress Response
section.subtitle: YOUR DARK SIDE - Understand how you react under pressure
section.description: Think about how you naturally respond when you feel stressed, threatened, or overwhelmed.

domains.name: Fight
domains.description: Confront & Control - Move toward the threat with aggression or defensiveness

domains.name: Flight
domains.description: Escape & Avoid - Try to escape or distance yourself from the situation

domains.name: Freeze
domains.description: Pause & Shut Down - Become immobile or mentally check out

domains.name: Fawn
domains.description: Please & Appease - Try to please others to avoid conflict

questions.text: When someone criticises me, I tend to argue back or defend myself.
When I feel overwhelmed, I want to leave the situation immediately.
Under extreme stress, my mind goes blank and I can't think clearly.
I often agree with others just to keep the peace.
I become more assertive and forceful when I feel threatened.
I avoid difficult conversations whenever possible.
When faced with a big problem, I sometimes feel paralysed.
I find it hard to say no to people, even when I should.
I speak up loudly when I feel I'm being treated unfairly.
I prefer to walk away from conflict rather than engage.
I sometimes zone out or feel disconnected when things get too stressful.
I worry a lot about what others think of me.
I can become angry or irritable when under pressure.
When I feel anxious, I try to distract myself with other activities.
I sometimes feel stuck and unable to make decisions.
I tend to put others' needs before my own.
I confront problems head-on rather than avoiding them.
I procrastinate on tasks that make me anxious.
In overwhelming situations, I feel like I'm watching myself from outside.
I often apologise even when it's not my fault.
I don't back down easily in an argument.
I would rather avoid a problem than deal with it directly.
I sometimes forget things when I'm very stressed.
I change my opinions to match whoever I'm talking to.
I feel more energised and focused when facing a challenge.
I feel better when I can escape from stressful environments.
I sometimes feel numb or emotionless during very stressful times.
I try very hard to make everyone around me happy.
I can be blunt or harsh when I'm stressed.
I tend to withdraw from people when I'm feeling stressed.
I have trouble starting tasks when I feel overwhelmed.
I feel responsible for other people's feelings.
I prefer to take control of difficult situations.
I often make excuses to avoid situations that make me uncomfortable.
My body feels heavy or tired when I'm very stressed.
I avoid expressing my true feelings to prevent upsetting others.
I stand my ground even when others push back.
I daydream or mentally escape when situations become too stressful.
I find it hard to concentrate when I'm under a lot of pressure.
I adjust my behaviour to gain approval from others.

stressInfo.description: Everyone uses all four responses at different times. Your dominant response is your go-to pattern under stress.

management.FIG: Practice pausing before reacting. Channel energy into problem-solving rather than confrontation.
management.FLI: Face small challenges gradually. Build confidence through exposure to manageable stressors.
management.FRE: Break tasks into tiny steps. Use grounding techniques to stay present.
management.FAW: Practice setting small boundaries. Remember that saying no is healthy.
